content.description: Not much to look at but the there is real climbing to the upper head wall where you will find "real" climbing.
content.location: North end of the West face.  Climbs a couple of short corners to a steep head wall.

content.description: This climb has the feel of an old school Windy Point route.  Thin balancy face with thin pro and some runs between pieces.  I used a 00 cam and could have used two near the top.  Interesting bolt protected move low and some hard moves higher with very thin pro.
content.protection: 1 Bolt and gear to green Cams.  Descend by walking around.  You can drop down as you reach the Main wall or walk around it.
content.location: Just right of the middle of the S. face.

content.description: Moderate climbing to the right of a pretty arete I have looked at for 30 years.  Great finish on steep rock.
content.location: Continue South 100 feet (toward town) along the base of the Hooligan's Hollow dropping down a ways to avoid the manzanita.  You will reach a point where you will see the arete.  The East face of this chunk of rock is where you will find the start.

content.description:
This route has an interesting start with a traverse to a corner then an unlikely one foot step up to some slab moves and a steep arete finish.   

  As a bonus there is a short steep crack to the left of the anchors that can be TR'd.  It has some loose blocks at the start of the crack so trundle them or dance around them.
content.location: All the way around to the west side of the formation.  It starts on steep jugs below a face covered with overlaps.

content.description: This route has a short section that leads to a terrace.  It then steps back left and gets in your face.  Eventually you reach a big roof that can be hard if you don't see it.
content.location: It is the prow on the N. end.

content.description: Stout crack to a ledge then a fun sustained section of face leading to steep moves at the end.
content.location: Left center of the east face.  Starts up a crack the works up arete/buttress

content.description: Stout moves lead to a hard second clip. Pay attention.  This has some good crack/face moves.
content.location: This route is the second route left of the right (north)edge.

content.description: This is the obvious shallow corner system with a couple of slight jogs in it.  Takes really good gear but you want to be good at small stuff to do the first 10 feet or so or don't fall off.  We cleaned up a small amount of loose stuff.  It is worth bringing a one of everything rack down the hill to do this.
content.protection: Gear, light rack and no anchor.  Descend by walking back around the main crag at Hooligan's Hollow.
content.location: Just to the right of Skaliwags on the formation 100 feet south of the main crag.

content.description: Harder if you are shorter than about 5'8" but still fun.  Face climbing around a roof to a neat corner.
content.location: Just right of the left end of the cliff.

content.description: Corner to face with a devious crux to a finish that just gets steeper.  Clipping the anchors off of the finish jugs can be the crux.
content.location: In the middle of the left hand face.  Start in a good sized left facing corner.

content.description: Steep off the deck then pretty easy to a steep plated headwall.
content.protection: Gear and two bolts up high.  One of everything rack to Yellow Camalot.
content.location: Starts just right of two sections of plated face that angle up and left.  Climb steep rock to ledge then up corner to bolts and plates.

content.description: Great thin face climbing up an arete.  Very short for a route but long for a boulder problem.
content.location: South end of the East face.

content.description: Easy access along the ridge that leads past the North Fin and behind Mean Mistreater then past Obscured By Clouds Crag.  This cliff has a neat roof capped prow on the north end but most routes face east.  It is not that tall but the routes are better than they look.  It should be reasonable to climb winter, spring and fall but a little warm if the temps in Tucson are above 80 degrees.
